dublin_core.dcvalue: Panel Enabling Interoperability A new era of digital health has emphasized the need for systems interoperability as we move from isolated pilot projects to national scale deployments The first presentation in this session looks at the use of concept dictionaries which facilitate the sharing and storing of data across different organizations working within shared populations Hear more about the new open source frontline health worker digital health solution OpenSRP a key emphases of this technology is its interoperability with existing national eHealth and digital health systems such as DHIS2 and OpenMRS Next presenters will share their experience designing a technology enabled national health information system in Tanzania based on co creation approach These innovations and approaches will help the advancement of new technology to support national level information systems Presented byKatherine Healy Research Associate Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public HealthKelsey Zeller Research Associate Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health
Made available in DSpace on 2020-06-22T11:11:26Z (GMT). No. of bitstreams: 1 2016_digital_health_forum_concept_dictionaries.pptx: 23712514 bytes, checksum: 206ef98bd93380815ed8fe0104f57928 (MD5)
A Transition from Pilot Projects to Scalable Solutions: Concept Dictionaries for Public Health
